org.apache.xalan.xslt.util

Class XslTransformEvaluationHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.xalan.xslt.util.XslTransformEvaluationHelper

  • public class XslTransformEvaluationHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class, defines few utility methods, that provide support for Xalan-J's XSL 3 transformation processor implementation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      XslTransformEvaluationHelper()

    • Method Detail

      • expandResultSequence

        public static void expandResultSequence(ResultSequence seqToBeExpanded,
                                        ResultSequence finalResultSeq)
        Given an xdm input sequence, expand that sequence to produce a new sequence none of whose items are sequence with cardinality greater than one. The caller of this method, needs to pass an xdm sequence to be expanded as an argument, and another argument reference to get the result from this method.

      • replaceNsUrisWithPrefixesOnXPathStr

        public static java.lang.String replaceNsUrisWithPrefixesOnXPathStr(java.lang.String xpathExprStr,
                                                                   java.util.List<XMLNSDecl> nsPrefixTable)
        Given an XPath expression string, replace XML namespace uri references within it, with the corresponding declared XML namespace prefixes, using information from the list object 'nsPrefixTable' passed to this method.

      • isTunnelAttributeYes

        public static boolean isTunnelAttributeYes(java.lang.String val)
        This method checks whether, an XSL xsl:with-param/xsl:param tunnel attribute's value is true (i.e, having string values "yes", "true", or "1").

                                                  char lParentType,
                                                  char rParenType)
        This method definition, is used to check whether the supplied string value has balanced parentheses pairs.

      • isSequenceContainsAllXDMAtomicValues

        public static boolean isSequenceContainsAllXDMAtomicValues(ResultSequence resultSeq)
        Method definition to check whether, all the values of the supplied input sequence are XPath atomic values.
        Parameters:
        resultSeq - The supplied XPath sequence object
        Returns:
        boolean value true or false

      • characterMapTransformation

        public static java.lang.String characterMapTransformation(java.lang.String strValue,
                                                          CharacterMapConfig charMapConfig)
        This method definition does the xsl:character-map transformation on the supplied string value, using a CharacterMapConfig run-time object.
        Parameters:
        strValue - Supplied string value
        charMapConfig - CharacterMapConfig run-time object
        Returns:
        The modified string value after doing xsl:character-map transformation.

      • getElemFunctionFromNodeTestExpression

        public static ElemFunction getElemFunctionFromNodeTestExpression(NodeTest nodeTest,
                                                                 TransformerImpl transformerImpl,
                                                                 javax.xml.transform.SourceLocator srcLocator)
                                                          throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
        Function definition to get xsl:function's compiled ElemFunction object, given a NodeTest expression.
        Parameters:
        nodeTest - An object instance for example, constructed from XPath named function references like fn0:abc#1.
        transformerImpl - An XSL transform TransformerImpl object
        srcLocator - SourceLocator object in XPath context
        Returns:
        An ElemFunction object if available, otherwise null
        Throws:
        javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
